attributes.action: Put speed bumps on the duel carriage way on Blackbird Road and Devonshire Road
attributes.additional_details:
Recently my cat Mew was hit by two vehicles on Devonshire Road. I saw the CCTV footage, the first car was coming fast when he hit her; she was dragged from underneath his car to the next. In the footage she was alive and for a few minutes then she passed away. 
On Blackbird Road my cat Tiny was hit and died on the spot. The road should have speed bumps so people are more careful while driving. 
There have been many accidents on Blackbird Road in Leicester. It is important to add speed bumps here
attributes.background: There have been many accidents that have taken place in Leicester Blackbird Road which have resulted in loss of animal and human life.

rejection.details:
We were really sorry to read about the loss of your cats, and to hear about the other accidents in your area. 

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Safety on local roads is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
